defmodule AthenaCapture.PTZCameraCapture do
  @moduledoc """
  Captures still images from PTZ cameras and emits events for athena-ingest processing.
  
  Provides functionality to position PTZ camera (pan, tilt, zoom) and capture high-quality
  still images, processing them into structured events that feed into the athena knowledge graph pipeline.
  
  PTZ Camera Workflow:
  1. Position camera (pan/tilt/zoom operations)
  2. Capture still image using imagesnap
  3. Store with metadata including position data
  
  Image Storage:
  - Image files: Saved to disk at ~/.athena/ptz_captures/ (JPEG format for efficiency)
  - Metadata: Stored in SQLite via EventStore (position, settings, file path, etc.)
  - Events: Tracked in EventDashboard for real-time monitoring
  """
  
  use GenServer
  require Logger
  
  @captures_dir Path.expand("~/.athena/ptz_captures")
  @default_format "jpg"
  @ptz_executable "/Users/j/Code/logi-ptz/webcam-ptz/webcam-ptz"
  
  defstruct [
    :captures_dir,
    :last_capture,
    :last_position,
    :ptz_executable
  ]
  
  # Client API
  
  def start_link(opts \\ []) do
    GenServer.start_link(__MODULE__, opts, name: __MODULE__)
  end
  
  def capture_with_position(position_opts, capture_opts \\ []) do
    GenServer.call(__MODULE__, {:capture_with_position, position_opts, capture_opts}, 30_000)
  end
  
  def capture_current_position(opts \\ []) do
    GenServer.call(__MODULE__, {:capture_current_position, opts})
  end
  
  def position_camera(position_opts) do
    GenServer.call(__MODULE__, {:position_camera, position_opts})
  end
  
  def get_last_position do
    GenServer.call(__MODULE__, :get_last_position)
  end
  
  # Server Callbacks
  
  def init(opts) do
    Logger.info("Starting PTZCameraCapture - saving captures to #{@captures_dir}")
    
    # Ensure captures directory exists
    File.mkdir_p!(@captures_dir)
    
    # Verify PTZ executable exists
    ptz_executable = Keyword.get(opts, :ptz_executable, @ptz_executable)
    case File.exists?(ptz_executable) do
      true ->
        Logger.info("PTZ executable found at #{ptz_executable}")
      false ->
        Logger.warning("PTZ executable not found at #{ptz_executable} - positioning will fail")
    end
    
    state = %__MODULE__{
      captures_dir: @captures_dir,
      last_capture: nil,
      last_position: %{},
      ptz_executable: ptz_executable
    }
    
    {:ok, state}
  end
  
  def handle_call({:capture_with_position, position_opts, capture_opts}, _from, state) do
    result = do_capture_with_position(position_opts, capture_opts, state)
    {:reply, result, update_last_capture_and_position(state, result, position_opts)}
  end
  
  def handle_call({:capture_current_position, opts}, _from, state) do
    result = do_capture_current_position(opts, state)
    {:reply, result, update_last_capture(state, result)}
  end
  
  def handle_call({:position_camera, position_opts}, _from, state) do
    result = do_position_camera(position_opts, state)
    new_state = case result do
      :ok -> %{state | last_position: position_opts}
      _ -> state
    end
    {:reply, result, new_state}
  end
  
  def handle_call(:get_last_position, _from, state) do
    {:reply, state.last_position, state}
  end
  
  # Private Functions
  
  defp do_capture_with_position(position_opts, capture_opts, state) do
    Logger.info("PTZ sequence: positioning then capturing")
    
    # Step 1: Position the camera
    case do_position_camera(position_opts, state) do
      :ok ->
        # Brief pause to allow camera to settle after movement
        Process.sleep(500)
        
        # Step 2: Capture the image
        do_capture_current_position(capture_opts, state)
        
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to position camera: #{reason}")
        {:error, "positioning_failed: #{reason}"}
    end
  end
  
  defp do_capture_current_position(opts, state) do
    filename = generate_filename("ptz_capture", opts)
    filepath = Path.join(state.captures_dir, filename)
    
    case run_imagesnap([filepath]) do
      :ok ->
        metadata = build_metadata("ptz_capture", filepath, opts, state.last_position)
        emit_ptz_event("ptz_image_captured", metadata)
        {:ok, %{file: filepath, metadata: metadata}}
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to capture PTZ image: #{reason}")
        {:error, reason}
    end
  end
  
  defp do_position_camera(position_opts, state) do
    # Build PTZ command arguments
    args = build_ptz_args(position_opts)
    
    case File.exists?(state.ptz_executable) do
      true ->
        Logger.info("Positioning PTZ camera: #{Enum.join(args, " ")}")
        case System.cmd(state.ptz_executable, args, stderr_to_stdout: true) do
          {_output, 0} -> 
            Logger.info("PTZ positioning successful")
            :ok
          {error, code} -> 
            Logger.error("PTZ positioning failed (exit code #{code}): #{error}")
            {:error, "ptz_command_failed: #{error}"}
        end
      false ->
        Logger.error("PTZ executable not found at #{state.ptz_executable}")
        {:error, "ptz_executable_missing"}
    end
  end
  
  defp build_ptz_args(position_opts) do
    # Convert position options to PTZ command arguments
    # Expected format: ./webcam-ptz pan <position> [tilt <position>] [zoom <level>]
    args = []
    
    # Pan operation (required for most positioning)
    args = case Map.get(position_opts, :pan) do
      nil -> args
      pan_pos -> args ++ ["pan", to_string(pan_pos)]
    end
    
    # Tilt operation (optional)
    args = case Map.get(position_opts, :tilt) do
      nil -> args
      tilt_pos -> args ++ ["tilt", to_string(tilt_pos)]
    end
    
    # Zoom operation (optional)
    args = case Map.get(position_opts, :zoom) do
      nil -> args
      zoom_level -> args ++ ["zoom", to_string(zoom_level)]
    end
    
    # If no operations specified, default to pan middle
    if Enum.empty?(args), do: ["pan", "middle"], else: args
  end
  
  defp run_imagesnap(args) do
    case System.cmd("imagesnap", args, stderr_to_stdout: true) do
      {_output, 0} -> :ok
      {error, _code} -> {:error, error}
    end
  end
  
  defp generate_filename(type, opts) do
    timestamp = DateTime.utc_now() |> DateTime.to_iso8601(:basic)
    format = Map.get(opts, :format, @default_format)
    tag = Map.get(opts, :tag, "")
    
    base_name = if tag != "", do: "#{type}_#{tag}_#{timestamp}", else: "#{type}_#{timestamp}"
    "#{base_name}.#{format}"
  end
  
  defp build_metadata(capture_type, filepath, opts, position) do
    {:ok, stat} = File.stat(filepath)
    
    %{
      capture_type: capture_type,
      file_path: filepath,
      file_name: Path.basename(filepath),
      size: stat.size,
      created_at: stat.ctime,
      format: Path.extname(filepath) |> String.trim_leading("."),
      options: opts,
      position: position,
      checksum: calculate_checksum(filepath),
      camera_type: "ptz",
      executable_path: @ptz_executable
    }
  end
  
  defp calculate_checksum(filepath) do
    filepath
    |> File.stream!([], 2048)
    |> Enum.reduce(:crypto.hash_init(:sha256), &:crypto.hash_update(&2, &1))
    |> :crypto.hash_final()
    |> Base.encode16(case: :lower)
  end
  
  defp emit_ptz_event(action, metadata) do
    event = %{
      type: "ptz_event",
      action: action,
      timestamp: DateTime.utc_now(),
      metadata: metadata
    }
    
    position_info = case metadata[:position] do
      pos when map_size(pos) > 0 ->
        pos_str = pos |> Enum.map(fn {k, v} -> "#{k}:#{v}" end) |> Enum.join(" ")
        " at position [#{pos_str}]"
      _ -> ""
    end
    
    Logger.info("Emitting PTZ event: #{action} for #{metadata.file_name}#{position_info}")
    
    # Ring the bell! ðŸ“¸
    AthenaCapture.EventDashboard.record_event("ptz_#{action}", metadata)
    
    # Store to durable SQLite storage ðŸ’¾
    AthenaCapture.EventStore.store_event("ptz_#{action}", metadata, event.timestamp)
    
    # TODO: Integrate with actual event bus/pipeline to athena-ingest
    # For now, just log the structured event
    Logger.debug("Event: #{inspect(event, pretty: true)}")
  end
  
  defp update_last_capture(state, result) do
    case result do
      {:ok, %{metadata: metadata}} ->
        %{state | last_capture: metadata}
      _ ->
        state
    end
  end
  
  defp update_last_capture_and_position(state, result, position_opts) do
    updated_state = update_last_capture(state, result)
    case result do
      {:ok, _} -> %{updated_state | last_position: position_opts}
      _ -> updated_state
    end
  end
end

file.content:
# Camera configuration for athena-ingest
cameras:
  # Camera identification and basic metadata
  camera_01:
    id: "camera_01"
    name: "Front Door"
    location: "entrance"
    coordinates:
      latitude: 40.7128
      longitude: -74.0060
    
    # Physical camera properties
    hardware:
      model: "Reolink RLC-410"
      resolution: "1920x1080"
      fps: 15
      field_of_view: 80
      night_vision: true
    
    # Integration settings
    detection_source:
      provider: "frigate"  # frigate | motion | webrtc
      endpoint: "http://frigate:5000/api/camera_01"
      stream_url: "rtsp://camera_01:554/stream"
    
    # Processing configuration
    processing:
      enabled: true
      motion_threshold: 0.3
      save_stills: true
      save_clips: true
      retain_days: 30
    
    # Storage paths (relative to event storage)
    storage:
      stills_path: "camera_stills/camera_01"
      clips_path: "camera_clips/camera_01"
      metadata_path: "camera_metadata/camera_01"

  camera_02:
    id: "camera_02"
    name: "Backyard"
    location: "garden"
    coordinates:
      latitude: 40.7129
      longitude: -74.0061
    
    hardware:
      model: "Hikvision DS-2CD2085FWD-I"
      resolution: "3840x2160"
      fps: 10
      field_of_view: 90
      night_vision: true
    
    detection_source:
      provider: "motion"
      endpoint: "http://motion:8080/camera_02"
      stream_url: "rtsp://camera_02:554/stream"
    
    processing:
      enabled: true
      motion_threshold: 0.2
      save_stills: true
      save_clips: false
      retain_days: 7
    
    storage:
      stills_path: "camera_stills/camera_02"
      clips_path: "camera_clips/camera_02"
      metadata_path: "camera_metadata/camera_02"

# Global camera settings
global:
  # Detection providers configuration
  providers:
    frigate:
      base_url: "http://frigate:5000"
      api_key: "${FRIGATE_API_KEY}"
      webhook_endpoint: "/api/events/camera"
    
    motion:
      base_url: "http://motion:8080"
      webhook_endpoint: "/api/events/camera"
    
    webrtc:
      base_url: "http://webrtc:8000"
      webhook_endpoint: "/api/events/camera"
  
  # Storage configuration
  storage:
    base_path: "/data/camera_events"
    cleanup_interval: "24h"
    compression: "gzip"
  
  # Processing defaults
  processing:
    default_retention_days: 14
    thumbnail_size: "320x240"
    thumbnail_quality: 85
    max_clip_duration: 300  # seconds

file.content:
defmodule PTZConnector.MixProject do
  use Mix.Project

  def project do
    [
      app: :ptz_connector,
      version: "1.0.0",
      elixir: "~> 1.18",
      start_permanent: Mix.env() == :prod,
      deps: deps(),
      releases: releases()
    ]
  end

  def application do
    [
      extra_applications: [:logger, :crypto],
      mod: {PTZConnector.Application, []}
    ]
  end

  defp deps do
    [
      # MQTT client for agent communication
      {:emqtt, "~> 1.12"},
      # JSON encoding/decoding
      {:jason, "~> 1.4"},
      # UUID generation for command IDs
      {:uuid, "~> 1.1"}
    ]
  end

  defp releases do
    [
      ptz_connector: [
        include_executables_for: [:unix],
        applications: [runtime_tools: :permanent],
        steps: [:assemble, :tar]
      ]
    ]
  end
end

file.content:
defmodule CameraCollector.Application do
  @moduledoc """
  Main application supervisor for the Camera Collector service.
  """
  use Application

  @impl true
  def start(_type, _args) do
    children = [
      # Configuration loader
      CameraCollector.Config,
      
      # Neo4j knowledge graph client
      CameraCollector.Neo4jClient,
      
      # Event storage and processing pipeline
      {Registry, keys: :unique, name: CameraCollector.EventRegistry},
      CameraCollector.EventStore,
      CameraCollector.EventPublisher,
      CameraCollector.EventProcessor,
      
      # Inference engine for generating insights
      CameraCollector.InferenceEngine,
      
      # Camera providers supervision tree
      CameraCollector.ProviderSupervisor,
      
      # HTTP server for receiving webhooks
      {Plug.Cowboy, scheme: :http, plug: CameraCollector.WebhookRouter, options: [port: 4000]}
    ]

    opts = [strategy: :one_for_one, name: CameraCollector.Supervisor]
    Supervisor.start_link(children, opts)
  end
end

content.content:
1	defmodule CameraCollector.EventProcessor do
     2	  @moduledoc """
     3	  Processes camera events and forwards them to the athena-ingest pipeline.
     4	  Uses Broadway for reliable, concurrent event processing.
     5	  """
     6	  use Broadway
     7	  require Logger
     8	
     9	  alias CameraCollector.{Event, EventPublisher, EventStore, Neo4jClient}
    10	
    11	  def start_link(opts) do
    12	    Broadway.start_link(__MODULE__,
    13	      name: __MODULE__,
    14	      producer: [
    15	        module: {CameraCollector.EventProducer, []},
    16	        stages: 1
    17	      ],
    18	      processors: [
    19	        default: [stages: 4]
    20	      ],
    21	      batchers: [
    22	        athena: [stages: 2, batch_size: 10, batch_timeout: 2000]
    23	      ]
    24	    )
    25	  end
    26	
    27	  def process_event(%Event{} = event) do
    28	    Logger.debug("Received camera event: #{event.camera_id} - #{event.event_type}")
    29	    
    30	    # Store event for RAG citations and future reprocessing
    31	    case EventStore.store_event(event) do
    32	      {:ok, storage_ref} ->
    33	        Logger.debug("Stored event #{event.event_id} with ref: #{storage_ref.citation_ref}")
    34	        
    35	        # Also store in Neo4j knowledge graph
    36	        spawn(fn ->
    37	          case Neo4jClient.store_event_in_graph(event) do
    38	            {:ok, :stored} ->
    39	              Logger.debug("Stored event #{event.event_id} in knowledge graph")
    40	            
    41	            {:error, reason} ->
    42	              Logger.warn("Failed to store event #{event.event_id} in Neo4j: #{inspect(reason)}")
    43	          end
    44	        end)
    45	        
    46	        # Send event to Broadway pipeline for forwarding to athena-ingest
    47	        GenStage.cast(__MODULE__.Producer, {:event, event})
    48	        
    49	      {:error, reason} ->
    50	        Logger.error("Failed to store event #{event.event_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
    51	        # Still process the event even if storage fails
    52	        GenStage.cast(__MODULE__.Producer, {:event, event})
    53	    end
    54	  end
    55	
    56	  @impl true
    57	  def handle_message(_, %Broadway.Message{data: event} = message, _) do
    58	    case process_camera_event(event) do
    59	      {:ok, processed_event} ->
    60	        Logger.debug("Processed event #{processed_event.event_id}")
    61	        
    62	        # Mark event as processed in storage with current processing version
    63	        EventStore.mark_event_processed(processed_event.event_id, current_processing_version())
    64	        
    65	        # Tag for batching to athena-ingest
    66	        message
    67	        |> Broadway.Message.put_data(processed_event)
    68	        |> Broadway.Message.put_batcher(:athena)
    69	
    70	      {:error, reason} ->
    71	        Logger.error("Failed to process event #{event.event_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
    72	        Broadway.Message.failed(message, reason)
    73	    end
    74	  end
    75	
    76	  @impl true
    77	  def handle_batch(:athena, messages, _batch_info, _context) do
    78	    events = Enum.map(messages, & &1.data)
    79	    
    80	    case EventPublisher.publish_batch(events) do
    81	      :ok ->
    82	        Logger.info("Published batch of #{length(events)} events to athena-ingest")
    83	        messages
    84	
    85	      {:error, reason} ->
    86	        Logger.error("Failed to publish batch: #{inspect(reason)}")
    87	        Enum.map(messages, &Broadway.Message.failed(&1, reason))
    88	    end
    89	  end
    90	
    91	  # Private functions
    92	
    93	  defp process_camera_event(%Event{} = event) do
    94	    processed_event = event
    95	    |> enhance_with_camera_metadata()
    96	    |> add_file_paths()
    97	    |> mark_as_processed()
    98	
    99	    {:ok, processed_event}
   100	  rescue
   101	    e -> {:error, e}
   102	  end
   103	
   104	  defp enhance_with_camera_metadata(%Event{camera_id: camera_id} = event) do
   105	    case CameraCollector.Config.get_camera(String.to_atom(camera_id)) do
   106	      nil ->
   107	        Logger.warn("Camera configuration not found for #{camera_id}")
   108	        event
   109	
   110	      camera_config ->
   111	        %{event |
   112	          camera_name: camera_config.name || camera_id,
   113	          location: build_enhanced_location(camera_config)
   114	        }
   115	    end
   116	  end
   117	
   118	  defp add_file_paths(%Event{} = event) do
   119	    base_path = get_storage_base_path()
   120	    timestamp_path = format_timestamp_path(event.timestamp)
   121	    
   122	    %{event |

defmodule CameraCollector.EventProcessor do
  @moduledoc """
  Processes camera events and forwards them to the athena-ingest pipeline.
  Uses Broadway for reliable, concurrent event processing.
  """
  use Broadway
  require Logger

  alias CameraCollector.{Event, EventPublisher, EventStore, Neo4jClient}

  def start_link(opts) do
    Broadway.start_link(__MODULE__,
      name: __MODULE__,
      producer: [
        module: {CameraCollector.EventProducer, []},
        stages: 1
      ],
      processors: [
        default: [stages: 4]
      ],
      batchers: [
        athena: [stages: 2, batch_size: 10, batch_timeout: 2000]
      ]
    )
  end

  def process_event(%Event{} = event) do
    Logger.debug("Received camera event: #{event.camera_id} - #{event.event_type}")
    
    # Store event for RAG citations and future reprocessing
    case EventStore.store_event(event) do
      {:ok, storage_ref} ->
        Logger.debug("Stored event #{event.event_id} with ref: #{storage_ref.citation_ref}")
        
        # Also store in Neo4j knowledge graph
        spawn(fn ->
          case Neo4jClient.store_event_in_graph(event) do
            {:ok, :stored} ->
              Logger.debug("Stored event #{event.event_id} in knowledge graph")
            
            {:error, reason} ->
              Logger.warn("Failed to store event #{event.event_id} in Neo4j: #{inspect(reason)}")
          end
        end)
        
        # Send event to Broadway pipeline for forwarding to athena-ingest
        GenStage.cast(__MODULE__.Producer, {:event, event})
        
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to store event #{event.event_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
        # Still process the event even if storage fails
        GenStage.cast(__MODULE__.Producer, {:event, event})
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_message(_, %Broadway.Message{data: event} = message, _) do
    case process_camera_event(event) do
      {:ok, processed_event} ->
        Logger.debug("Processed event #{processed_event.event_id}")
        
        # Mark event as processed in storage with current processing version
        EventStore.mark_event_processed(processed_event.event_id, current_processing_version())
        
        # Tag for batching to athena-ingest
        message
        |> Broadway.Message.put_data(processed_event)
        |> Broadway.Message.put_batcher(:athena)

      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to process event #{event.event_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
        Broadway.Message.failed(message, reason)
    end
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_batch(:athena, messages, _batch_info, _context) do
    events = Enum.map(messages, & &1.data)
    
    case EventPublisher.publish_batch(events) do
      :ok ->
        Logger.info("Published batch of #{length(events)} events to athena-ingest")
        messages

      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to publish batch: #{inspect(reason)}")
        Enum.map(messages, &Broadway.Message.failed(&1, reason))
    end
  end

  # Private functions

  defp process_camera_event(%Event{} = event) do
    processed_event = event
    |> enhance_with_camera_metadata()
    |> add_file_paths()
    |> mark_as_processed()

    {:ok, processed_event}
  rescue
    e -> {:error, e}
  end

  defp enhance_with_camera_metadata(%Event{camera_id: camera_id} = event) do
    case CameraCollector.Config.get_camera(String.to_atom(camera_id)) do
      nil ->
        Logger.warn("Camera configuration not found for #{camera_id}")
        event

      camera_config ->
        %{event |
          camera_name: camera_config.name || camera_id,
          location: build_enhanced_location(camera_config)
        }
    end
  end

  defp add_file_paths(%Event{} = event) do
    base_path = get_storage_base_path()
    timestamp_path = format_timestamp_path(event.timestamp)
    
    %{event |
      still_path: build_file_path(base_path, event.camera_id, timestamp_path, "still.jpg"),
      thumbnail_path: build_file_path(base_path, event.camera_id, timestamp_path, "thumb.jpg"),
      clip_path: case event.event_type do
        type when type in [:recording_started, :motion_detected] ->
          build_file_path(base_path, event.camera_id, timestamp_path, "clip.mp4")
        _ -> nil
      end
    }
  end

  defp mark_as_processed(%Event{} = event) do
    %{event | processed_at: DateTime.utc_now()}
  end

  defp build_enhanced_location(camera_config) do
    %{
      name: camera_config.location,
      coordinates: camera_config.coordinates,
      zone: Map.get(camera_config, :zone),
      field_of_view: get_in(camera_config, [:hardware, :field_of_view]),
      coverage_area: get_in(camera_config, [:hardware, :coverage_area])
    }
  end

  defp get_storage_base_path do
    case CameraCollector.Config.get_providers() do
      %{storage: %{base_path: path}} -> path
      _ -> "/data/camera_events"
    end
  end

  defp format_timestamp_path(%DateTime{} = timestamp) do
    Calendar.strftime(timestamp, "%Y/%m/%d/%H")
  end

  defp build_file_path(base_path, camera_id, timestamp_path, filename) do
    Path.join([base_path, camera_id, timestamp_path, filename])
  end

  defp current_processing_version do
    Application.get_env(:camera_collector, :processing_version, "1.0")
  end

  # Public API for reprocessing stored events
  def reprocess_events(since \\ nil) do
    Logger.info("Starting event reprocessing#{if since, do: " since #{DateTime.to_iso8601(since)}", else: ""}")
    
    case EventStore.get_raw_events_for_reprocessing(since) do
      {:ok, raw_events} ->
        Logger.info("Found #{length(raw_events)} events for reprocessing")
        
        reprocessed_count = Enum.reduce(raw_events, 0, fn raw_event, count ->
          case reprocess_raw_event(raw_event) do
            {:ok, _event} -> count + 1
            {:error, reason} ->
              Logger.warn("Failed to reprocess event #{raw_event["event_id"]}: #{inspect(reason)}")
              count
          end
        end)
        
        Logger.info("Successfully reprocessed #{reprocessed_count} events")
        {:ok, reprocessed_count}
      
      error ->
        Logger.error("Failed to get events for reprocessing: #{inspect(error)}")
        error
    end
  end

  defp reprocess_raw_event(raw_event) do
    try do
      # Recreate event from raw payload
      provider = String.to_atom(raw_event["provider"])
      
      event = case provider do
        :frigate ->
          Event.from_frigate_event(raw_event["raw_payload"])
        
        :motion ->
          Event.from_motion_event(raw_event["raw_payload"])
        
        _ ->
          Event.new(%{
            camera_id: raw_event["camera_id"],
            event_type: :object_detected,
            provider: provider,
            raw_payload: raw_event["raw_payload"]
          })
      end
      
      # Process with current pipeline
      case process_camera_event(event) do
        {:ok, processed_event} ->
          # Update the stored event with new processing
          EventStore.store_event(processed_event)
          
          # Forward to athena-ingest
          EventPublisher.publish_event(processed_event)
          
          # Mark as reprocessed
          EventStore.mark_event_processed(raw_event["event_id"], current_processing_version())
          
          {:ok, processed_event}
        
        error ->
          error
      end
      
    rescue
      e ->
        {:error, e}
    end
  end
end

defmodule CameraCollector.EventProducer do
  @moduledoc """
  GenStage producer for camera events.
  """
  use GenStage
  require Logger

  def start_link(opts) do
    GenStage.start_link(__MODULE__, opts, name: __MODULE__)
  end

  @impl true
  def init(_opts) do
    {:producer, %{queue: :queue.new(), demand: 0}}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_cast({:event, event}, %{queue: queue, demand: demand} = state) do
    queue = :queue.in(event, queue)
    dispatch_events(queue, demand, [])
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_demand(incoming_demand, %{queue: queue, demand: demand} = state) do
    dispatch_events(queue, demand + incoming_demand, [])
  end

  defp dispatch_events(queue, demand, events) do
    with true <- demand > 0,
         {{:value, event}, queue} <- :queue.out(queue) do
      
      message = %Broadway.Message{
        data: event,
        acknowledger: {__MODULE__, :ack_id, :ack_data}
      }
      
      dispatch_events(queue, demand - 1, [message | events])
    else
      _ ->
        {:noreply, Enum.reverse(events), %{queue: queue, demand: demand}}
    end
  end
end

defmodule CameraCollector.WebhookRouter do
  @moduledoc """
  HTTP webhook router for receiving camera events from detection providers.
  """
  use Plug.Router
  require Logger

  plug Plug.Logger
  plug :match
  plug Plug.Parsers, parsers: [:json], json_decoder: Jason
  plug :dispatch

  # Health check endpoint
  get "/health" do
    conn
    |> put_resp_content_type("application/json")
    |> send_resp(200, Jason.encode!(%{status: "ok", service: "camera_collector"}))
  end

  # Frigate webhook endpoint
  post "/webhook/frigate" do
    case process_frigate_event(conn.body_params) do
      {:ok, event} ->
        CameraCollector.EventProcessor.process_event(event)
        send_resp(conn, 200, "OK")
      
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to process Frigate event: #{inspect(reason)}")
        send_resp(conn, 400, "Bad Request")
    end
  end

  # Motion webhook endpoint  
  post "/webhook/motion" do
    case process_motion_event(conn.body_params) do
      {:ok, event} ->
        CameraCollector.EventProcessor.process_event(event)
        send_resp(conn, 200, "OK")
      
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to process Motion event: #{inspect(reason)}")
        send_resp(conn, 400, "Bad Request")
    end
  end

  # WebRTC webhook endpoint
  post "/webhook/webrtc" do
    case process_webrtc_event(conn.body_params) do
      {:ok, event} ->
        CameraCollector.EventProcessor.process_event(event)
        send_resp(conn, 200, "OK")
      
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to process WebRTC event: #{inspect(reason)}")
        send_resp(conn, 400, "Bad Request")
    end
  end

  # Generic camera event endpoint
  post "/webhook/camera/:camera_id" do
    camera_id = conn.path_params["camera_id"]
    
    case process_generic_event(camera_id, conn.body_params) do
      {:ok, event} ->
        CameraCollector.EventProcessor.process_event(event)
        send_resp(conn, 200, "OK")
      
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to process camera event for #{camera_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
        send_resp(conn, 400, "Bad Request")
    end
  end

  # Catch-all for unmatched routes
  match _ do
    send_resp(conn, 404, "Not Found")
  end

  # Private functions for processing different event types

  defp process_frigate_event(payload) do
    Logger.debug("Processing Frigate event: #{inspect(payload)}")
    
    with {:ok, camera_config} <- get_camera_config(payload["camera"]),
         {:ok, event} <- build_frigate_event(payload, camera_config) do
      {:ok, event}
    else
      error -> error
    end
  end

  defp process_motion_event(payload) do
    Logger.debug("Processing Motion event: #{inspect(payload)}")
    
    with {:ok, camera_config} <- get_camera_config(payload["camera_id"]),
         {:ok, event} <- build_motion_event(payload, camera_config) do
      {:ok, event}
    else
      error -> error
    end
  end

  defp process_webrtc_event(payload) do
    Logger.debug("Processing WebRTC event: #{inspect(payload)}")
    
    with {:ok, camera_config} <- get_camera_config(payload["camera_id"]),
         {:ok, event} <- build_webrtc_event(payload, camera_config) do
      {:ok, event}
    else
      error -> error
    end
  end

  defp process_generic_event(camera_id, payload) do
    Logger.debug("Processing generic event for #{camera_id}: #{inspect(payload)}")
    
    with {:ok, camera_config} <- get_camera_config(camera_id),
         {:ok, event} <- build_generic_event(camera_id, payload, camera_config) do
      {:ok, event}
    else
      error -> error
    end
  end

  defp get_camera_config(camera_id) do
    case CameraCollector.Config.get_camera(String.to_atom(camera_id)) do
      nil -> {:error, "Camera #{camera_id} not found in configuration"}
      config -> {:ok, config}
    end
  end

  defp build_frigate_event(payload, camera_config) do
    event = CameraCollector.Event.from_frigate_event(payload)
    
    enhanced_event = %{event |
      camera_name: camera_config.name,
      location: build_location(camera_config)
    }
    
    {:ok, enhanced_event}
  rescue
    e -> {:error, "Failed to build Frigate event: #{inspect(e)}"}
  end

  defp build_motion_event(payload, camera_config) do
    event = CameraCollector.Event.from_motion_event(payload)
    
    enhanced_event = %{event |
      camera_name: camera_config.name,
      location: build_location(camera_config)
    }
    
    {:ok, enhanced_event}
  rescue
    e -> {:error, "Failed to build Motion event: #{inspect(e)}"}
  end

  defp build_webrtc_event(payload, camera_config) do
    event = CameraCollector.Event.new(%{
      camera_id: camera_config.id,
      camera_name: camera_config.name,
      event_type: determine_event_type(payload),
      provider: :webrtc,
      location: build_location(camera_config),
      raw_payload: payload
    })
    
    {:ok, event}
  rescue
    e -> {:error, "Failed to build WebRTC event: #{inspect(e)}"}
  end

  defp build_generic_event(camera_id, payload, camera_config) do
    event = CameraCollector.Event.new(%{
      camera_id: camera_id,
      camera_name: camera_config.name,
      event_type: determine_event_type(payload),
      provider: :generic,
      location: build_location(camera_config),
      raw_payload: payload
    })
    
    {:ok, event}
  rescue
    e -> {:error, "Failed to build generic event: #{inspect(e)}"}
  end

  defp build_location(camera_config) do
    %{
      name: camera_config.location,
      coordinates: camera_config.coordinates,
      zone: Map.get(camera_config, :zone),
      field_of_view: get_in(camera_config, [:hardware, :field_of_view])
    }
  end

  defp determine_event_type(payload) do
    cond do
      Map.has_key?(payload, "motion") -> :motion_detected
      Map.has_key?(payload, "person") -> :person_detected
      Map.has_key?(payload, "vehicle") -> :vehicle_detected
      Map.has_key?(payload, "recording") -> :recording_started
      true -> :object_detected
    end
  end
end

defmodule CameraCollector.ProviderSupervisor do
  @moduledoc """
  Supervisor for camera provider integrations.
  Manages polling connections to detection systems that don't support webhooks.
  """
  use DynamicSupervisor
  require Logger

  def start_link(opts) do
    DynamicSupervisor.start_link(__MODULE__, opts, name: __MODULE__)
  end

  @impl true
  def init(_opts) do
    DynamicSupervisor.init(strategy: :one_for_one)
  end

  def start_provider_poller(camera_id, provider_config) do
    spec = {CameraCollector.ProviderPoller, {camera_id, provider_config}}
    DynamicSupervisor.start_child(__MODULE__, spec)
  end

  def stop_provider_poller(camera_id) do
    case Registry.lookup(CameraCollector.EventRegistry, {:poller, camera_id}) do
      [{pid, _}] ->
        DynamicSupervisor.terminate_child(__MODULE__, pid)
      [] ->
        {:error, :not_found}
    end
  end

  def list_active_pollers do
    DynamicSupervisor.which_children(__MODULE__)
  end
end

defmodule CameraCollector.ProviderPoller do
  @moduledoc """
  Generic poller for detection providers that don't support webhooks.
  Polls provider APIs for new events and forwards them to the event processor.
  """
  use GenServer
  require Logger

  @default_poll_interval 5_000

  def start_link({camera_id, provider_config}) do
    GenServer.start_link(__MODULE__, {camera_id, provider_config}, 
      name: {:via, Registry, {CameraCollector.EventRegistry, {:poller, camera_id}}})
  end

  @impl true
  def init({camera_id, provider_config}) do
    poll_interval = Map.get(provider_config, :poll_interval, @default_poll_interval)
    
    state = %{
      camera_id: camera_id,
      provider_config: provider_config,
      poll_interval: poll_interval,
      last_event_time: DateTime.utc_now(),
      timer_ref: nil
    }

    Logger.info("Starting provider poller for camera #{camera_id}")
    
    # Schedule first poll
    timer_ref = Process.send_after(self(), :poll, 1000)
    
    {:ok, %{state | timer_ref: timer_ref}}
  end

  @impl true
  def handle_info(:poll, state) do
    case poll_provider(state) do
      {:ok, events} when length(events) > 0 ->
        Logger.debug("Polled #{length(events)} events for camera #{state.camera_id}")
        Enum.each(events, &CameraCollector.EventProcessor.process_event/1)
        
      {:ok, []} ->
        Logger.debug("No new events for camera #{state.camera_id}")
        
      {:error, reason} ->
        Logger.error("Failed to poll camera #{state.camera_id}: #{inspect(reason)}")
    end

    # Schedule next poll
    timer_ref = Process.send_after(self(), :poll, state.poll_interval)
    
    {:noreply, %{state | timer_ref: timer_ref}}
  end

  @impl true
  def terminate(_reason, state) do
    if state.timer_ref do
      Process.cancel_timer(state.timer_ref)
    end
    
    Logger.info("Stopped provider poller for camera #{state.camera_id}")
    :ok
  end

  # Private functions

  defp poll_provider(%{provider_config: %{provider: :frigate}} = state) do
    poll_frigate(state)
  end

  defp poll_provider(%{provider_config: %{provider: :motion}} = state) do
    poll_motion(state)
  end

  defp poll_provider(%{provider_config: %{provider: :webrtc}} = state) do
    poll_webrtc(state)
  end

  defp poll_provider(state) do
    Logger.warn("Unknown provider for camera #{state.camera_id}")
    {:ok, []}
  end

  defp poll_frigate(state) do
    endpoint = state.provider_config.endpoint
    since = DateTime.to_unix(state.last_event_time)
    
    url = "#{endpoint}/events?after=#{since}&camera=#{state.camera_id}"
    
    case HTTPoison.get(url) do
      {:ok, %{status_code: 200, body: body}} ->
        case Jason.decode(body) do
          {:ok, events} when is_list(events) ->
            camera_events = Enum.map(events, &convert_frigate_event(&1, state.camera_id))
            {:ok, camera_events}
          
          {:ok, _} ->
            {:ok, []}
          
          {:error, reason} ->
            {:error, "JSON decode error: #{inspect(reason)}"}
        end
      
      {:ok, %{status_code: code}} ->
        {:error, "HTTP #{code}"}
      
      {:error, reason} ->
        {:error, reason}
    end
  end

  defp poll_motion(state) do
    # Motion doesn't typically have a polling API, so this would be empty
    # unless you're using a custom Motion setup with API access
    {:ok, []}
  end

  defp poll_webrtc(state) do
    # Similar to Motion, WebRTC would typically be webhook-based
    {:ok, []}
  end

  defp convert_frigate_event(frigate_event, camera_id) do
    camera_config = CameraCollector.Config.get_camera(String.to_atom(camera_id))
    
    CameraCollector.Event.from_frigate_event(frigate_event)
    |> Map.put(:camera_name, camera_config.name)
    |> Map.put(:location, build_location(camera_config))
  end

  defp build_location(camera_config) do
    %{
      name: camera_config.location,
      coordinates: camera_config.coordinates,
      zone: Map.get(camera_config, :zone),
      field_of_view: get_in(camera_config, [:hardware, :field_of_view])
    }
  end
end

content.text:
Based on my analysis of the athena codebase, here's what I found regarding existing PTZ connector code and camera functionality:

## Existing PTZ and Camera Code

### 1. PTZ Camera Capture Module
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-capture/athena_capture/lib/athena_capture/ptz_camera_capture.ex`

This is a comprehensive PTZ camera control and capture module that includes:
- **PTZ positioning** (pan, tilt, zoom operations)
- **Image capture** using imagesnap
- **Event emission** to EventDashboard and EventStore
- **Storage management** (saves to `~/.athena/ptz_captures/`)
- **Metadata tracking** (position data, file paths, checksums)

Key features:
- Uses external PTZ executable: `/Users/j/Code/logi-ptz/webcam-ptz/webcam-ptz`
- Supports positioning with pan/tilt/zoom parameters
- Integrates with the athena event system
- 500ms settling delay after camera movement

### 2. Camera Configuration System
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ingest/config/cameras.example.yaml`

Defines camera configuration structure including:
- Camera identification and metadata
- Hardware specifications (model, resolution, FPS)
- Detection source providers (Frigate, Motion, WebRTC)
- Processing and storage settings
- Location and coordinate data

### 3. Camera Collection Infrastructure
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ingest/camera_collector/`

A complete camera event processing system with:
- **Webhook router** for receiving events from detection providers
- **Event processor** using Broadway for reliable processing
- **Provider supervisor** for managing polling connections
- **Event storage** and forwarding to athena-ingest pipeline
- **Neo4j integration** for knowledge graph storage

### 4. Current PTZ Connector Stub
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ptz-connector/mix.exs`

Currently contains only a basic Mix project configuration with:
- MQTT client dependency (emqtt)
- JSON handling (jason)
- UUID generation
- Application structure for PTZ connector

## Organization Structure Recommendations

### Option 1: Minimal Move (Recommended)
**Keep the existing PTZ code where it is** and use `athena-ptz-connector` for **specialized connector integrations** like:
- MQTT-based PTZ camera connectors
- Network protocol adapters (ONVIF, RTSP control)
- Third-party PTZ system integrations
- Multi-camera PTZ orchestration

**Rationale**: The existing PTZ code in `athena-capture` is well-integrated with the event system and works with local USB PTZ cameras. Moving it would break existing integrations.

### Option 2: Gradual Migration
**Phase 1**: Build new connector types in `athena-ptz-connector`
**Phase 2**: Gradually refactor shared PTZ functionality into common modules
**Phase 3**: Migrate existing code if needed for consistency

### Option 3: Complete Reorganization
**Move all PTZ-related code** to `athena-ptz-connector` including:
- The existing `ptz_camera_capture.ex` module
- PTZ-specific configuration handling
- PTZ event processing logic

**Risk**: This would require significant refactoring of the athena-capture system and updating all references.

## Recommended Approach

I recommend **Option 1** - keeping the existing PTZ camera capture code in `athena-capture` since it's:
1. **Well-integrated** with the existing event system
2. **Functionally complete** for local PTZ camera operations
3. **Already working** with the current architecture

Use `athena-ptz-connector` for:
- **Network-based PTZ connectors** (ONVIF, IP cameras)
- **MQTT PTZ integrations** (as suggested by the existing dependencies)
- **Multi-camera coordination** and orchestration
- **Third-party PTZ system adapters**

This approach maintains backward compatibility while providing a clear separation between local PTZ operations (athena-capture) and distributed PTZ connectivity (athena-ptz-connector).

- 500ms settling delay after camera movement

### 2. Camera Configuration System
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ingest/config/cameras.example.yaml`

Defines camera configuration structure including:
- Camera identification and metadata
- Hardware specifications (model, resolution, FPS)
- Detection source providers (Frigate, Motion, WebRTC)
- Processing and storage settings
- Location and coordinate data

### 3. Camera Collection Infrastructure
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ingest/camera_collector/`

A complete camera event processing system with:
- **Webhook router** for receiving events from detection providers
- **Event processor** using Broadway for reliable processing
- **Provider supervisor** for managing polling connections
- **Event storage** and forwarding to athena-ingest pipeline
- **Neo4j integration** for knowledge graph storage

### 4. Current PTZ Connector Stub
**Location**: `/Users/j/Code/athena/athena-ptz-connector/mix.exs`

Currently contains only a basic Mix project configuration with:
- MQTT client dependency (emqtt)
- JSON handling (jason)
- UUID generation
- Application structure for PTZ connector

## Organization Structure Recommendations

### Option 1: Minimal Move (Recommended)
**Keep the existing PTZ code where it is** and use `athena-ptz-connector` for **specialized connector integrations** like:
- MQTT-based PTZ camera connectors
- Network protocol adapters (ONVIF, RTSP control)
- Third-party PTZ system integrations
- Multi-camera PTZ orchestration

**Rationale**: The existing PTZ code in `athena-capture` is well-integrated with the event system and works with local USB PTZ cameras. Moving it would break existing integrations.

### Option 2: Gradual Migration
**Phase 1**: Build new connector types in `athena-ptz-connector`
**Phase 2**: Gradually refactor shared PTZ functionality into common modules
**Phase 3**: Migrate existing code if needed for consistency

### Option 3: Complete Reorganization
**Move all PTZ-related code** to `athena-ptz-connector` including:
- The existing `ptz_camera_capture.ex` module
- PTZ-specific configuration handling
- PTZ event processing logic

**Risk**: This would require significant refactoring of the athena-capture system and updating all references.

## Recommended Approach

I recommend **Option 1** - keeping the existing PTZ camera capture code in `athena-capture` since it's:
1. **Well-integrated** with the existing event system
2. **Functionally complete** for local PTZ camera operations
3. **Already working** with the current architecture

Use `athena-ptz-connector` for:
- **Network-based PTZ connectors** (ONVIF, IP cameras)
- **MQTT PTZ integrations** (as suggested by the existing dependencies)
- **Multi-camera coordination** and orchestration
- **Third-party PTZ system adapters**

This approach maintains backward compatibility while providing a clear separation between local PTZ operations (athena-capture) and distributed PTZ connectivity (athena-ptz-connector).

Based on the search results, I can see there's already substantial PTZ functionality in `athena-capture/athena_capture/lib/athena_capture/ptz_camera_capture.ex` that's well-integrated with the event system.

For organizing multiple connectors, I recommend creating a `connectors/` directory structure:

```
athena/
â”œâ”€â”€ connectors/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ athena-ptz-connector/     # Network PTZ integrations
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ athena-mqtt-connector/    # MQTT broker connections  
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ athena-onvif-connector/   # ONVIF camera protocols
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ athena-rtsp-connector/    # RTSP stream handling
```

This keeps the existing PTZ capture code in `athena-capture` (since it's working well) and uses `athena-ptz-connector` for network-based PTZ integrations. Should I create this structure and move the current `athena-ptz-connector` into it?

file.content:
defmodule PTZConnector.MixProject do
  use Mix.Project

  def project do
    [
      app: :ptz_connector,
      version: "1.0.0",
      elixir: "~> 1.18",
      start_permanent: Mix.env() == :prod,
      deps: deps(),
      releases: releases()
    ]
  end

  def application do
    [
      extra_applications: [:logger, :crypto],
      mod: {PTZConnector.Application, []}
    ]
  end

  defp deps do
    [
      # MQTT client for agent communication
      {:emqtt, "~> 1.12"},
      # JSON encoding/decoding
      {:jason, "~> 1.4"},
      # UUID generation for command IDs
      {:uuid, "~> 1.1"}
    ]
  end

  defp releases do
    [
      ptz_connector: [
        include_executables_for: [:unix],
        applications: [runtime_tools: :permanent],
        steps: [:assemble, :tar]
      ]
    ]
  end
end

It offers capabilities that align well with your objectives of integrating structured data, images, and even image segmentations into a knowledge graph. Here's how LlamaIndex can support your specific needs:([The AiEdge Newsletter][1])

    12

    14

    20	
    21	* **Image Embeddings**: Utilize models like CLIP to generate embeddings for images, enabling similarity searches and retrieval tasks. ([LlamaIndex][5])
    22	
    23	* **Multi-Modal Retrieval**: Combine text and image data within the same index, allowing for complex queries that span both modalities. 
    24	
    25	---
    26	
    27	### ðŸ–Œï¸ Image Segmentation (Masks)
    28	
    29	For handling image segmentations:
    30	
    31	* **External Processing**: While LlamaIndex doesn't directly process segmentation masks, you can use external tools like the Segment Anything Model (SAM) to generate masks. ([arXiv][6])
    32	
    33	* **Metadata Integration**: Once you have segmentation data (e.g., masks, bounding boxes), you can attach this information as metadata to the corresponding images within LlamaIndex. This enables querying based on specific segments or regions within images.

    40	
    41	* **Structured Data Mapping**: Extract structured information from documents and map them to nodes and relationships in Neo4j, aligning with schema.org types.

[![How To Build a Multimodal RAG Pipeline With LlamaIndex](https://tse4.mm.bing.net/th?id=OIP.lkhij-H1n4Utp7isY9YgTwHaGN\&pid=Api)](https://newsletter.theaiedge.io/p/how-to-build-a-multimodal-rag-pipeline-8d6)

LlamaIndex is a versatile framework designed to ingest, transform, and index various data typesâ€”including text and imagesâ€”for use in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines. It offers capabilities that align well with your objectives of integrating structured data, images, and even image segmentations into a knowledge graph. Here's how LlamaIndex can support your specific needs:([The AiEdge Newsletter][1])

---

### ðŸ§© Schema.org Integration

While LlamaIndex doesn't natively support schema.org, it provides flexible mechanisms to incorporate structured data:

* **Custom Metadata**: You can attach schema.org types and properties as metadata to documents during ingestion. This metadata becomes part of the index and can be utilized during queries. ([LlamaIndex][2])

* **JSON Query Engine**: LlamaIndex offers a JSON query engine that allows querying JSON documents conforming to a specific schema. This can be leveraged to work with schema.org-structured data. ([LlamaIndex][3])

---

### ðŸ–¼ï¸ Image Ingestion and Processing

LlamaIndex supports multi-modal data, including images:([LlamaIndex][4])

* **Image Embeddings**: Utilize models like CLIP to generate embeddings for images, enabling similarity searches and retrieval tasks. ([LlamaIndex][5])

* **Multi-Modal Retrieval**: Combine text and image data within the same index, allowing for complex queries that span both modalities. 

---

### ðŸ–Œï¸ Image Segmentation (Masks)

For handling image segmentations:

* **External Processing**: While LlamaIndex doesn't directly process segmentation masks, you can use external tools like the Segment Anything Model (SAM) to generate masks. ([arXiv][6])

* **Metadata Integration**: Once you have segmentation data (e.g., masks, bounding boxes), you can attach this information as metadata to the corresponding images within LlamaIndex. This enables querying based on specific segments or regions within images.

---

### ðŸ§  Integration with Neo4j

LlamaIndex can be integrated with Neo4j to build and manage knowledge graphs:

* **Structured Data Mapping**: Extract structured information from documents and map them to nodes and relationships in Neo4j, aligning with schema.org types.

* **Deduplication**: Implement deduplication strategies during ingestion to ensure unique entities within your knowledge graph.

---

### ðŸ”„ Sample Workflow

1. **Data Ingestion**: Load text, images, and structured data into LlamaIndex, attaching relevant metadata.

2. **Processing**: Generate embeddings for text and images; process images externally for segmentation masks if needed.

3. **Indexing**: Create a multi-modal index that supports complex queries across different data types.([llamaindexxx.readthedocs.io][7])

4. **Integration**: Map extracted entities and relationships to Neo4j, building a comprehensive knowledge graph.([GitHub][8])

---

By leveraging LlamaIndex's capabilities, you can effectively manage and query a rich, multi-modal dataset, integrating structured data, images, and segmentations into a cohesive knowledge graph. If you need assistance with specific implementation details or have further questions, feel free to ask!

[1]: https://newsletter.theaiedge.io/p/how-to-build-a-multimodal-rag-pipeline-8d6?utm_source=chatgpt.com "How To Build a Multimodal RAG Pipeline With LlamaIndex"
[2]: https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/module_guides/loading/documents_and_nodes/usage_documents/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Defining and Customizing Documents - LlamaIndex"
[3]: https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/query_engine/json_query_engine/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "JSON Query Engine - LlamaIndex"
[4]: https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/multi_modal/replicate_multi_modal/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Multi-Modal LLM using Replicate LlaVa, Fuyu 8B, MiniGPT4 models ..."
[5]: https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/examples/multi_modal/image_to_image_retrieval/?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Image to Image Retrieval using CLIP embedding and ... - LlamaIndex"
[6]: https://arxiv.org/html/2404.08767v1?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Bridging Image Segmentation and Large Language Model Reasoning"
[7]: https://llamaindexxx.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples/multi_modal/image_to_image_retrieval.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com "Image to Image Retrieval using CLIP embedding and ... - LlamaIndex"
[8]: https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/issues/13985?utm_source=chatgpt.com "[Question]: How to write production grade code #13985 - GitHub"

    56	Cropâ€‘andâ€‘CLIP	Tightâ€‘crop mask â†’ CLIP image encoder	Simpler, fine for medium/large objects
    57	Maskedâ€‘pooling on SAMâ€¯2 features	Average Hiera features under mask â†’ 256â€‘D â†’ tiny MLP to CLIP space	Faster (no extra encode), survives tiny or thin masks
    58	
    59	Repos such as Groundedâ€‘SAM, Groundedâ€‘SAMâ€¯2 and Semanticâ€‘SAM already expose helper scripts to call SAMâ€¯2 and spit out CLIPâ€‘compatible vectors in batches 
    60	github.com
    61	github.com
    62	github.com
    63	.
    64	If small items matter (loose screws, teaspoons), fineâ€‘tune with MaskCLIP++; its maskâ€‘aware contrastive loss boosts smallâ€‘region accuracy byâ€¯â‰ˆâ€¯6â€¯mIoU on COCO 
    65	arxiv.org
    66	openreview.net
    67	.
    68	
    69	4â€¯Â·â€¯Vector storage & retrieval
    70	FAISS (Meta) â€” classic GPU/CPU ANN search, handles tens of millions of vectors on one workstation 
    71	github.com
    72	engineering.fb.com
    73	.
    74	
    75	Qdrant â€” productionâ€‘grade server with REST/gRPC, supports multimodal filtering and payloads (e.g., cameraâ€‘ID, timestamp) out of the box 
    76	qdrant.tech
    77	.
    78	
    79	LanceDB â€” arrowâ€‘backed DB that adds Deltaâ€‘like versioning; great if you want to timeâ€‘travel embeddings or do parquet analytics later 
    80	lancedb.com
    81	.

    83	Store vectors as float16; at 50â€¯masks/frame Ã— 12â€¯fps Ã— 15â€¯cameras youâ€™ll add ~5â€¯GB/day, well within commodity NVMe.
    84	
    85	5â€¯Â·â€¯Reasoning & automations
    86	TextÂ â†’Â vector query: embed phrases such as â€œstack of platesâ€â€¯,â€¯â€œopen tool chest drawerâ€.
    87

    91	
    92	â€œIf you see package_on_porch and the mailbox camera has no person for 5â€¯min, ask Jonathan to bring the package inside.â€
    93	
    94	Push actionable events to HomeÂ Assistant, Slack, or custom webhooks.
    95	
    96	Because the vectors stay stable, you usually query far less often than you ingest â€” the heavy lifting is SAMâ€¯2 + CLIP.
    97

    99	Inference GPU: a single RTXÂ 4090 (~24â€¯GB) can run SAMâ€¯2 at â‰ˆâ€¯50â€¯MP/s; thatâ€™s ~10Ã— faster than you need for 15â€¯Ã—â€¯1080p@1â€¯fps. If you crank to 4â€¯fps, consider dualâ€‘GPU or split SAM (GPUâ€¯1) / CLIP (GPUâ€¯2).
   100	
   101	CPU / RAM: 16â€¯cores, 32â€¯GB is fine; embeddings are tiny.

# Surveillance System - IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE ðŸš€

**Enterprise-grade computer vision surveillance with real-time dashboard and intelligent rules.**

## Quick Start
```bash
docker-compose up -d              # Start all services
open http://localhost:8080        # View dashboard  
python3 src/integration_test.py   # Run tests
```

## Status
âœ… **CLIP encoding server** - FastAPI with batch processing  
âœ… **Rules engine** - 4 surveillance rules configured  
âœ… **Real-time dashboard** - Professional monitoring interface  
âœ… **Docker orchestration** - Complete microservice architecture  
âœ… **32 test images** - Ready for validation  
âœ… **Integration tests** - All systems validated  

---

Below is a fieldâ€‘tested way to wire a â€œwatchâ€‘everythingâ€ pipeline that digestsâ€¯â‰ˆâ€¯15 cameras, snapshots once everyâ€¯1â€¯â€“â€¯5â€¯s, and turns each frame into vectors a languageâ€‘model can reason over (e.g., â€œhey, thatâ€™s a new UPS package on the porch â€” remind me to bring it inâ€).

1â€¯Â·â€¯Highâ€‘level flow
mathematica
Copy
Edit
Cameras â†’ Frame grabber â†’ SAMâ€¯2 masks â†’ CLIP (or MaskCLIP/Semanticâ€‘SAM) embeddings
     â†’ Vector DB (FAISS / Qdrant / LanceDB) â†’ Query / LLM rules â†’ Actions & Alerts
Segment Anythingâ€¯2 gives you crisp, promptâ€‘free masks âš™ï¸â€¯once per frameâ€¯â€” thanks to its Hiera encoder you can reuse those features for all masks in that frame, keeping latency low 
ritvik19.medium.com
supervisely.com
.
Each mask turns into a 512â€‘/768â€‘D CLIPâ€‘aligned vector; zeroâ€‘shot text prompts (â€¯*â€œcardboard boxâ€â€¯,â€¯â€œdirty dishâ€â€¯,â€¯â€œloose screwdriverâ€â€¯) score against those vectors in a millisecond or two on CPU/GPU 
arxiv.org
medium.com
.
Vectors land in a similarity store such as FAISSâ€¯or Qdrant, both proven at millionâ€‘scale image search 
github.com
qdrant.tech
. A tiny ruleâ€‘engine or local LLM then turns matches into notifications or automations.

2â€¯Â·â€¯Frame capture & load balancing
Live feeds
Frigate NVR already handles RTSP/RTMP ingestion, motion preâ€‘filtering, and GPU scheduling, and exposes MQTT/Web hooks you can piggyâ€‘back on for downstream AI jobs 
frigate.video
.

For FPSâ€‘capped screenshots (1â€¯â€“â€¯12â€¯fps aggregate) a lean option is a Python/FFmpeg loop with PyAV; send frames to a Redis or Kafka queue so the rest of the stack can batchâ€‘process.

Moving heads / body cams
Give PTZ or wearables their own topic/partition so they donâ€™t starve fixed cams; SAM2 runtime is roughly linear in megapixels, not number of objects.

3â€¯Â·â€¯Mask + embedding stage
Option	How it works	When to pick
Cropâ€‘andâ€‘CLIP	Tightâ€‘crop mask â†’ CLIP image encoder	Simpler, fine for medium/large objects
Maskedâ€‘pooling on SAMâ€¯2 features	Average Hiera features under mask â†’ 256â€‘D â†’ tiny MLP to CLIP space	Faster (no extra encode), survives tiny or thin masks

Repos such as Groundedâ€‘SAM, Groundedâ€‘SAMâ€¯2 and Semanticâ€‘SAM already expose helper scripts to call SAMâ€¯2 and spit out CLIPâ€‘compatible vectors in batches 
github.com
github.com
github.com
.
If small items matter (loose screws, teaspoons), fineâ€‘tune with MaskCLIP++; its maskâ€‘aware contrastive loss boosts smallâ€‘region accuracy byâ€¯â‰ˆâ€¯6â€¯mIoU on COCO 
arxiv.org
openreview.net
.

4â€¯Â·â€¯Vector storage & retrieval
FAISS (Meta) â€” classic GPU/CPU ANN search, handles tens of millions of vectors on one workstation 
github.com
engineering.fb.com
.

Qdrant â€” productionâ€‘grade server with REST/gRPC, supports multimodal filtering and payloads (e.g., cameraâ€‘ID, timestamp) out of the box 
qdrant.tech
.

LanceDB â€” arrowâ€‘backed DB that adds Deltaâ€‘like versioning; great if you want to timeâ€‘travel embeddings or do parquet analytics later 
lancedb.com
.

Store vectors as float16; at 50â€¯masks/frame Ã— 12â€¯fps Ã— 15â€¯cameras youâ€™ll add ~5â€¯GB/day, well within commodity NVMe.

5â€¯Â·â€¯Reasoning & automations
TextÂ â†’Â vector query: embed phrases such as â€œstack of platesâ€â€¯,â€¯â€œopen tool chest drawerâ€.

Filter by time / camera / confidence in the DB, return the topâ€‘k segment IDs.

Pass cropped segment & metadata into a local LLM (e.g., LlamaÂ 3â€¯8B) with a tiny prompt like:

â€œIf you see package_on_porch and the mailbox camera has no person for 5â€¯min, ask Jonathan to bring the package inside.â€

Push actionable events to HomeÂ Assistant, Slack, or custom webhooks.

Because the vectors stay stable, you usually query far less often than you ingest â€” the heavy lifting is SAMâ€¯2 + CLIP.

6â€¯Â·â€¯Sizing the hardware
Inference GPU: a single RTXÂ 4090 (~24â€¯GB) can run SAMâ€¯2 at â‰ˆâ€¯50â€¯MP/s; thatâ€™s ~10Ã— faster than you need for 15â€¯Ã—â€¯1080p@1â€¯fps. If you crank to 4â€¯fps, consider dualâ€‘GPU or split SAM (GPUâ€¯1) / CLIP (GPUâ€¯2).

CPU / RAM: 16â€¯cores, 32â€¯GB is fine; embeddings are tiny.

Storage: 2â€¯TB NVMe per quarter keeps raw snapshots + vectors + logs.

7â€¯Â·â€¯Practical acceleration tips
Area / IoU filtering before CLIP cuts calls byâ€¯60â€‘80â€¯%.

Deduplicate masks across sequential frames with simple cosine >â€¯0.98; only new or changed regions hit the DB.

Async batch size: 64â€¯masks per CLIP pass maximizes RTX kernel occupancy.

Edge preâ€‘filter: let Frigate flag â€œmotionâ€ or â€œpersonâ€ frames and run full SAMâ€¯2 only on those; merges nicely with its MQTT events 
frigate.video
.

8â€¯Â·â€¯Putting it together (openâ€‘source stack)
Layer	Tooling	Why
Capture / motion	Frigate + FFmpeg	RTSP ingest, motion ROI, GPU demux
Segmentation	Segment Anythingâ€¯2 (PyTorch)	One encode per frame, multiâ€‘mask
Embedding	OpenCLIP / MaskCLIP++	512â€‘D vectors, zeroâ€‘shot text
Storage	Qdrant or LanceDB	Fast ANN, rich payloads
Orchestration	PydanticÂ +Â FastAPI or Ray Serve	Scales across GPUs/nodes
Reasoning	LlamaIndex / LangChain	Declarative graph of â€œif segment â†’ actionâ€

All pieces are containerâ€‘friendly; you can prototype with dockerâ€‘compose and add GPUs via --gpus all.

Where to go next
Prototype on a single cam with 1â€¯fps to benchmark latency.

Sketch your first â€œif toolâ€‘onâ€‘bench & >â€¯1â€¯h â†’ Slack meâ€ rule.

Add PTZ/body cams last; they need a tracker (e.g., Groundedâ€‘SAMâ€¯2â€™s builtâ€‘in) so SAMâ€¯2 doesnâ€™t rescan the whole frame every pan/tilt 
github.com
.

Ping me when you wire the first camera â€” happy to iterate on code, vectorâ€‘DB schema, or LLM prompts!

# Athena Capture

Real-time event detection and monitoring system for the Athena project ecosystem. Captures and stores raw event feeds for downstream processing by athena-ingest.

## Overview

Athena Capture is dedicated to the continuous monitoring and detection of various system events, user activities, and media changes. It maintains a lightweight, high-performance event detection engine that feeds raw data to the athena-ingest processing pipeline.

## Core Responsibilities

- **Event Detection**: Real-time monitoring of system and user activities
- **Raw Data Collection**: Capturing events in their original format
- **Event Feed Management**: Maintaining immutable event streams
- **Performance Optimization**: Minimal overhead continuous monitoring

## Features

### ðŸ” **Event Monitoring**
- **File System Events**: File creation, modification, deletion, access
- **Browser Activity**: Bookmarks, page visits, downloads, tab changes
- **Screen Capture**: Screenshot detection, window focus changes
- **System Events**: Application launches, config changes, network activity
- **Time Events**: Scheduled triggers, system clock changes
- **User Interactions**: Clicks, keyboard input, focus changes

### ðŸ“Š **Data Management**
- **Raw Event Storage**: Immutable event logs with timestamps
- **Event Streaming**: Real-time feed for downstream consumers
- **Buffer Management**: Efficient memory usage for continuous operation
- **Event Deduplication**: Intelligent filtering of redundant events

### ðŸš€ **Performance**
- **Low Latency**: Sub-millisecond event detection
- **Minimal Overhead**: <1% CPU usage during normal operation
- **Memory Efficient**: Bounded memory usage with circular buffers
- **Configurable Sampling**: Adjustable event collection rates

## Architecture

```
System Events â†’ Event Detectors â†’ Raw Event Buffer â†’ Event Feed API
     â†“              â†“                    â†“              â†“
File System    Browser Monitor    Memory Manager    athena-ingest
Screen Cap     Time Monitor       Persistence       External APIs
User Input     System Monitor     Streaming
```

## Event Types

### File System Events
```json
{
  "type": "file_event",
  "action": "created|modified|deleted|accessed",
  "path": "/path/to/file",
  "timestamp": "2025-06-06T22:52:00Z",
  "metadata": { "size": 1024, "ext": ".txt" }
}
```

### Browser Events
```json
{
  "type": "browser_event",
  "action": "bookmark_added|page_visit|download",
  "url": "https://example.com",
  "title": "Page Title",
  "timestamp": "2025-06-06T22:52:00Z"
}
```

### Screen Events
```json
{
  "type": "screen_event", 
  "action": "screenshot|window_focus|app_switch",
  "app": "Application Name",
  "timestamp": "2025-06-06T22:52:00Z",
  "metadata": { "window_title": "Document.txt" }
}
```

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Python 3.8+
- OS-specific monitoring libraries
- Appropriate system permissions for event monitoring

### Installation

```bash
cd athena-capture
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Configure system permissions
sudo python setup_permissions.py

# Start event monitoring
python -m athena_capture.main
```

### Usage

```python
from athena_capture import EventCapture, EventFeed

# Start capturing events
capture = EventCapture()
capture.start()

# Access event feed
feed = EventFeed()
for event in feed.stream():
    print(f"Event: {event}")

# Configure specific monitors
capture.configure_file_monitor("/path/to/watch")
capture.configure_browser_monitor(browsers=["chrome", "firefox"])
```

## Project Structure

```
athena-capture/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ monitors/           # Event detection modules
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ file_monitor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ browser_monitor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ screen_monitor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ system_monitor.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ feed/               # Event feed management
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ buffer.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ stream.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ persistence.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/                # External API interface
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ config/             # Configuration management
â”œâ”€â”€ tests/                  # Test files
â”œâ”€â”€ config/                 # Configuration files
â””â”€â”€ README.md              # This file
```

## Configuration

Event monitoring can be configured via `config/capture.yaml`:

```yaml
monitors:
  file_system:
    enabled: true
    paths: ["/home/user", "/Documents"]
    ignore_patterns: ["*.tmp", "*.log"]
  
  browser:
    enabled: true
    browsers: ["chrome", "firefox"]
    
  screen:
    enabled: true
    screenshot_interval: 30
    
performance:
  max_memory_mb: 512
  event_buffer_size: 10000
  flush_interval: 5
```

## API Interface

Athena Capture exposes a simple API for athena-ingest and other consumers:

```python
# REST API endpoints
GET /events/stream          # Real-time event stream
GET /events/recent?limit=100 # Recent events
GET /events/range?start=X&end=Y # Events in time range
GET /health                 # System health check
```

## Development Status

ðŸš§ **In Development** - Core event detection infrastructure is the immediate priority.

### Implementation Phases
1. **File System Monitoring** - Cross-platform file event detection
2. **Browser Integration** - Bookmark and activity monitoring
3. **Screen Capture** - Screenshot and window monitoring
4. **Event Feed API** - Streaming interface for athena-ingest
5. **Performance Optimization** - Memory and CPU efficiency
6. **Configuration System** - Flexible monitoring setup

## Integration with Athena Ingest

Athena Capture feeds events to [athena-ingest](../athena-ingest/) for processing:

```
athena-capture â†’ Event Feed â†’ athena-ingest â†’ Knowledge Graph
```

## Contributing

This is part of the larger Athena project ecosystem. Please refer to the main project guidelines for contribution standards.

# Athena Ingest

Multimodal data processing and knowledge graph construction system for the Athena project ecosystem. Processes raw event feeds from athena-capture through RAG pipelines to build comprehensive knowledge graphs.

## Overview

Athena Ingest is the data processing and knowledge extraction component of the Athena project. It consumes raw event feeds from [athena-capture](../athena-capture/) and transforms them into structured knowledge through multimodal RAG pipelines and graph construction.

## Core Responsibilities

- **Event Stream Processing**: Consuming and processing raw events from athena-capture
- **Multimodal RAG Pipeline**: Extracting knowledge from text, images, and structured data
- **Knowledge Graph Construction**: Building comprehensive knowledge graphs in Neo4j
- **Event Projections**: Creating specialized views and aggregations from event data

## Features

### ðŸ“Š **Event Stream Processing**
- **Real-time Processing**: Immediate processing of incoming event streams
- **Event Projections**: Creates derived views and aggregations from raw events
- **Batch Processing**: Efficient processing of historical event data
- **Event Filtering**: Intelligent selection of events for knowledge extraction

### ðŸ§  **Multimodal RAG Pipeline**
- **LlamaIndex Integration**: Leverages LlamaIndex for efficient data indexing and retrieval
- **Text Processing**: Document analysis, entity extraction, and semantic understanding
- **Image Processing**: CLIP embeddings for image-to-text and image-to-image retrieval
- **Image Segmentation**: Integration with external segmentation tools (SAM)
- **Schema.org Support**: Custom metadata attachment for structured data

### ðŸ”— **Knowledge Graph Construction**
- **Neo4j Integration**: Building comprehensive knowledge graphs
- **Entity Resolution**: Deduplication and entity linking across data sources
- **Relationship Extraction**: Automatic relationship discovery and mapping
- **Graph Querying**: Advanced query capabilities across multimodal data

### ðŸ”„ **Data Transformation**
- **Event Normalization**: Standardizing diverse event formats
- **Content Extraction**: Extracting meaningful content from various media types
- **Metadata Enhancement**: Enriching events with additional context
- **Temporal Analysis**: Understanding time-based patterns and relationships

## Architecture

```
athena-capture â†’ Raw Event Feed â†’ Event Projections â†’ Knowledge Extraction
                                         â†“                    â†“
                               LlamaIndex Processing â†’ Neo4j Knowledge Graph
                                         â†“                    â†“
                              Multimodal Index â†â†’ Query Interface
```

### Data Flow
1. **Event Consumption**: Receives events from athena-capture event feed
2. **Event Processing**: Filters, normalizes, and enriches incoming events
3. **Projection Generation**: Creates specialized views (file changes, user patterns, etc.)
4. **Knowledge Extraction**: LlamaIndex processing for content understanding
5. **Graph Construction**: Entities and relationships indexed in Neo4j
6. **Query Interface**: Unified querying across all processed data

## Event Processing

### File System Events
- Content extraction from modified files
- Document indexing and semantic analysis
- File relationship mapping (imports, references)

### Browser Events
- Bookmark content analysis and categorization
- Web page content extraction and indexing
- Research pattern recognition

### Screen Events
- OCR processing of screenshots
- UI element recognition and categorization
- Application usage pattern analysis

### Temporal Analysis
- Time-based event correlation
- Usage pattern recognition
- Productivity insights and recommendations

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Python 3.8+
- LlamaIndex
- Neo4j (for knowledge graph storage)
- CLIP (for image embeddings)
- Running [athena-capture](../athena-capture/) instance

### Installation

```bash
cd athena-ingest
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Set up Neo4j connection
cp config/neo4j.example.yaml config/neo4j.yaml
# Edit config/neo4j.yaml with your Neo4j credentials

# Configure event feed connection
cp config/capture.example.yaml config/capture.yaml
# Edit config/capture.yaml with athena-capture connection details
```

### Usage

```python
from athena_ingest import EventProcessor, KnowledgeGraph

# Connect to athena-capture event feed
processor = EventProcessor()
processor.connect_to_capture_feed("http://localhost:8080/events/stream")

# Start processing events
processor.start_processing()

# Query knowledge graph
graph = KnowledgeGraph()
results = graph.query("Find documents related to 'machine learning'")
```

## Project Structure

```
athena-ingest/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ processors/         # Event processing components
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ file_processor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ browser_processor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ screen_processor.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ event_router.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ projections/        # Event projection generators
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ file_timeline.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ usage_patterns.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ content_analysis.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ rag/               # LlamaIndex RAG pipeline
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ indexing.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ embeddings.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ retrieval.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ graph/             # Knowledge graph integration
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ neo4j_client.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ entity_linker.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ relationship_extractor.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ api/               # Query interface
â”œâ”€â”€ tests/                 # Test files
â”œâ”€â”€ config/                # Configuration files
â””â”€â”€ README.md             # This file
```

## Configuration

Processing can be configured via `config/ingest.yaml`:

```yaml
event_feed:
  source: "http://localhost:8080/events/stream"
  batch_size: 100
  processing_interval: 5

processors:
  file_events:
    enabled: true
    extract_content: true
    supported_types: [".txt", ".md", ".py", ".js"]
  
  browser_events:
    enabled: true
    extract_page_content: true
    bookmark_analysis: true
    
  screen_events:
    enabled: false  # Requires OCR setup
    ocr_engine: "tesseract"

rag:
  llama_index:
    model: "text-embedding-ada-002"
    chunk_size: 512
    overlap: 50
    
neo4j:
  uri: "bolt://localhost:7687"
  username: "neo4j"
  database: "athena"
```

## Event Projections

Athena Ingest creates various projections from raw events:

- **File Timeline**: Chronological view of file modifications
- **Usage Patterns**: Application and productivity insights
- **Content Categories**: Automatic classification of documents and media
- **Research Threads**: Connected topics and investigation paths
- **Relationship Networks**: People, projects, and concept connections

## API Interface

```python
# REST API endpoints
GET /graph/search?q=query        # Search knowledge graph
GET /projections/timeline        # File modification timeline
GET /projections/patterns        # Usage pattern analysis
GET /entities/{id}/related       # Related entities and relationships
POST /graph/query               # Custom graph queries
```

## Integration with Athena Capture

Athena Ingest connects to [athena-capture](../athena-capture/) via event streaming:

```
athena-capture â†’ Event Stream â†’ athena-ingest â†’ Knowledge Graph
```

Connection is established through the capture feed API and can handle both real-time and historical event processing.

## Documentation

Detailed project documentation is available in the [`../docs/`](../docs/) directory:

- [`../docs/overview.md`](../docs/overview.md) - Comprehensive project overview
- [`../docs/plan.md`](../docs/plan.md) - Implementation roadmap and phases

## Development Status

ðŸš§ **In Development** - Event processing pipeline and LlamaIndex integration are the immediate priorities.

### Implementation Phases
1. **Event Feed Integration** - Connect to athena-capture streams
2. **Basic Event Processing** - File and browser event processing
3. **LlamaIndex Pipeline** - Content extraction and indexing
4. **Knowledge Graph Construction** - Neo4j integration and entity linking
5. **Projection Generation** - Specialized event views and analysis
6. **Query Interface** - Advanced search and relationship exploration

## Contributing

This is part of the larger Athena project ecosystem. Please refer to the main project guidelines for contribution standards.

## License

[Add your license information here]

1	# Webcam Image Processing Pipeline
     2	
     3	A pipeline that processes webcam images, performs segmentation using Segment Anything (SAM), and saves the results.
     4	
     5	## Overview
     6	
     7	This project sets up a pipeline to process live webcam feeds. The pipeline:
     8	
     9	1. Reads configuration from a YAML file containing webcam URLs
    10	2. Polls each webcam every second
    11	3. Saves raw images locally
    12	4. Runs segmentation on each image using SAM (Segment Anything)
    13	5. Extracts and saves all detected objects/features with their masked images
    14	
    15	## Features
    16	
    17	- **YAML Configuration**: Easy setup via configuration files
    18	- **Real-time Processing**: Polls webcam feeds every second
    19	- **Image Segmentation**: Uses Segment Anything Model for object detection
    20	- **Feature Extraction**: Automatically extracts all detected objects
    21	- **Local Storage**: Saves both raw images and segmented results
    22	- **Masked Images**: Generates and saves masked versions of detected objects
    23	
    24	## Requirements
    25	
    26	- Python 3.8+
    27	- OpenCV (`cv2`)
    28	- requests
    29	- PyYAML
    30	- Pillow (PIL)
    31	- numpy
    32	
    33	## Installation
    34	
    35	```bash
    36	# Clone the repository
    37	git clone <repository-url>
    38	cd athena-sam
    39	
    40	# Install dependencies
    41	pip install -r requirements.txt
    42	```
    43	
    44	**Note**: This project uses a remote SAM server running at `http://llm:8100`. No local SAM model installation is required.
    45	
    46	## SAM Server
    47	
    48	The Segment Anything Model (SAM) runs on a dedicated server accessible at `http://llm:8100`. 
    49	
    50	### Server Management
    51	
    52	The SAM server is managed via Docker Compose on the `llm` machine:
    53	
    54	```bash
    55	# SSH to the SAM server machine
    56	ssh j@llm
    57	
    58	# Navigate to the docker-compose directory
    59	cd ~/docker-compose/sam
    60	
    61	# Check server status
    62	docker-compose ps
    63	
    64	# Start the server (if not running)
    65	docker-compose up -d
    66	
    67	# Stop the server
    68	docker-compose down
    69	
    70	# View server logs
    71	docker-compose logs -f
    72	```
